abstract: Royal Dutch Shell is dangling the prospect of a 15 percent-plus bump in its offer to buy oil patch subsidiary Shell Canada for C$7.7 billion ($6.6 billion), if minority shareholders agree to support its takeover bid, The Globe and Mail reported. Apparently frustrated in its attempts to drum up interest in a 40-Canadian-dollars -a-share offer made in October, and fearing a nasty takeover battle, Royal Dutch has been quietly meeting with the biggest shareholders in its Calgary-based offspring in recent weeks, the report said. Money managers in Toronto and Calgary told the newspaper that the parent company is holding out the promise of $46 to $48 a share if institutions agree to commit their shares.
